title.narrative: Inclusion of older people in disaster resilience in South Asia

description.narrative: Holding 50 grassroots-level meetings with communities, institutions and authorities about older people's role in DRR | Providing first aid, fire safety, search and rescue equipment to OPAs in 50 communities | Delivering 50 training sessions on early-warning systems and stockpiling | Delivering 10 training sessions to caregivers on supporting frail older people in disaster responses | Delivering training of trainers workshops on HOPE (Helping Older People in Emergencies) package to local, national and international NGOs in-country | Disbursing seed grants to 50 OPAs for disaster resilient community livelihoods | Conducting training on environmental protection and climate change adaptation in 12 communities to increase older people's ability to protect themselves and their families from disasters | Publish older people inclusive DRR training materials | Organise age-inclusive DRR fair at community level | Promote older people inclusive DRR and emergency response through local radio stations | Develop regionally appropriate criteria and procedures for allocating initial emergency response funding.

To develop community-based disaster risk reduction (DRR) programmes in Nepal and Bangladesh; to improve the ability of actors to deliver inclusive humanitarian assistance; to establish a Regional Emergency Fund to increase funding for low-profile natural disasters.
